Description: Hollow-cast bronze figure, a mummy-case for the remains of an ichneumon, in the form of an obelisk, inscribed on one side with a amuletic formula containing the name of Horus of Pe, with figure of Horus enthroned and wearing kilt, wig and double crown, base damaged and exterior worn.
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Horus of Pe
Acquisition name: Purchased through: R J Moss & Co
